sub_topic: Identifying the isomorphism between two graphs.
message_2:
Yes, G and H are isomorphic. An isomorphism between these graphs can be defined as follows:

f(1) = a
f(2) = b
f(3) = c
f(4) = d

This mapping preserves the adjacency of vertices in both graphs. For example, in graph G, vertices 1 and 2 are adjacent, and in graph H, vertices a and b are adjacent. This holds true for all other pairs of adjacent vertices in both graphs.
